meanings.definition: Consisting of a single melodic line.
meanings.sent1: The monophonic song featured only one melody throughout.
meanings.sent2: The choir performed a beautiful monophonic piece at the concert.
meanings.sent3: I tried to sing a monophonic tune, but ended up harmonizing with myself!
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the empty hall, creating a monophonic sound.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the monophonic composition left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to music that has only one voice or part.
meanings.sent1: The monophonic performance highlighted the soloist's talent.
meanings.sent2: The ancient chant was a perfect example of monophonic music.
meanings.sent3: The monophonic melody floated through the air, captivating everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: His guitar playing was so mesmerizing, it felt like a monophonic symphony.
meanings.sent5: The purity of the monophonic sound resonated deeply with the listeners.
